website_summaries.verdict: A quality aluminum ladder that retracts down to just over 3', although some may find the weight to be a bit much for general household use.
pros: Extends out to 15.5' (shorter sizes also available)
Made from an aerospace aluminum alloy
cons: A little on the heavy side for general use
Some found that the plastic thumb slides don't work well, making it hard to retract this option

customer_reviews.title: DANGEROUS Ladder - Be very careful
customer_reviews.text: DANGEROUS Ladder - Be very careful. The first time I retracted this ladder, it cut my finger badly - see photo. Now being very wary of this product, I asked my wife to trial test it first so I extended it (according to the enclosed instructions by the 3rd rung) and leaned it against a wall. It collapsed under her 100 pound weight, and fortunately I was able to catch her without injury to either of us. It is completely UNSAFE - should not be sold. It is on its way back to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Antony Williams

customer_reviews.title: The upper sections un-latch more easily, but the tenancy is to grab the rung ...
customer_reviews.text: I have the 15 foot version and it wants to hurt me. The lower section's latches don't want to un-latch or move. I can't get them to retract. The upper sections un-latch more easily, but the tenancy is to grab the rung and use your thumb to retract the latch as it is hard to move. The result is it would be very easy to have the ladder drop onto your fingers. It is heavy enough it would surly break them if this happened. I have never felt safe or secure using it. Maybe the shorter ones are easier to manage, but I'm cutting this one up and throwing it away before it hurts me or others.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: DISAPPOINTED
customer_reviews.text: Good idea but mine gives me fits with the plastic thumb slides not working well so the ladder is a real "bear" (being polite) to return to compact size. Worked ok the first time but it has been stored in the garage for 6 months and is now very inconsistent in the lock/release mechanism. You cant mess around with it much either, because when struggling with the slides it can release very quickly and pinch your hand painfully if it's out of position. Just sorry I'm past the time limit to return. Stainless release mechanisms would have made so much more sense.
customer_reviews.author: PONDER

customer_reviews.title: should have listen to all the other bad reviews saying the same thing
customer_reviews.text: Piece of garbagge, after 2 weeks of usage to climp 2 roofs everyday it would not close fully anymore....should have listen to all the other bad reviews saying the same thing...also no more return and the warranty is probably worthless... Would not recommend to buy this product, rather purchase in your local hardware store where they exchange your brokken goods
customer_reviews.author: Ivo

customer_reviews.title: Happy Firefighter!
customer_reviews.text: I am a firefighter and very particular about the quality of the ladders I use. I researched this ladder for my personal use at home, and was not disappointed when it arrived. High quality construction and very stable when extended. The "feet" are stable and very well designed with no slip grip. I would agree with the caution labels that you need to be careful with pinch points when retracting (or lowering) the ladder. I like this product for easy access around the house for changing light bulbs and smoke detector batteries. No need to drag the big extension ladder in any more. Not cheap... but worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: mountain j

customer_reviews.title: Not a toy
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars only because I watched a video on it that is no longer up. It showed a woman carrying it like it was nothing. She must of been a strong woman. This ladder is not a toy. It weighs a good bit. However due to that fact it is very, very durable. Easy to open and close. Just don't but it thinking you will carry it around like a purse. But it is good quality and I know I will use it for more than I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: John in WV

customer_reviews.title: replaces multiple other ladders
customer_reviews.text: this is my go-to ladder now, replaced several other step ladders and extending ones. quite sturdy and while a bit heavy, its OK to transport when collapsed and the carry strap is in place. Love the easy of use and feeling of security. One caution - READ the instructions, and KEEP THE FINGERS OUT OF THE WAY WHEN COLLAPSING! I knew what could happen otherwise, and well, it did! Not the ladders fault, clearly mine, but one time will remind you for many years to keep the hands and fingers where the instructions tell you to! Definitely recommend this ladder, use it all the time now
customer_reviews.author: Been there, tried that

customer_reviews.title: This to me is one of the best telescopic ladders you can get
customer_reviews.text: this is third one I have bought as an insurance adjuster. This to me is one of the best telescopic ladders you can get. It is light, easy to manipulate around someones home, has safety locks on each step so it never goes down more than 1 step, and it is easy to see and verify the step is locked. One secret to making these last is to collapse the last 2 steps upside down, much easier and does not put so much wear on the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: adrian medley

customer_reviews.title: Easier to handle than the Little Giant
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the Xtend & Climb 15.5 foot Ladder to replace my Little Giant which I used primarliy to access the roof of my motorhome which is 13 feet high. I found the Little Giant becoming too heavy to lift when extended from the ground to the roof, as I am now over 65 years old. The beauty of the Xtend & Climb is it raises one rung at a time from the vertical position. This made it much easier for me to handle as I never have to lift the already extended Little Giant to the roof. One other consideration is the laddee legs must be kept clean so as not to impead collapsing the ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Leininger

customer_reviews.title: Overkill
customer_reviews.text: Great concept and great to have in the back of a truck or easy storage in a closet but for the $$$ its not worth going with this unit. The regular one (Orange) is plenty tough enough for even general contracting type uses. This model is heavy and beefy. I think too much so. I wouldnt buy it again having seen how much overkill it is. We also have the orange one and its tough and holds up to everything it should.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Works Well...
customer_reviews.text: ... but it may be bigger (taller) than I need. No problem with the product - it works very well. In hindsight I should have ordered the 12.5 foot ladder for my application. I wanted the extra few feet for more versatility but I'm a small person and the added weight of the 15.5 foot ladder makes it difficult to deal with at times.
customer_reviews.author: GLH

customer_reviews.title: A superb ladder
customer_reviews.text: An incredible ladder. I bought this to access a roof space in a closet and it was perfect for the job. I also need it to access a light fitting in a 14foot ceiling and again it was perfect. Very stable to stand on and easily extended to any height....non slip at both ends either on the wall or the floor. Care does need to be taken when collapsing the ladder to keep ones hands clear....so follow the instructions exactly. This will by my "go to"ladder for all jobs
customer_reviews.author: ronald

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for RVs - a great product but watch the soft tissues!
customer_reviews.text: Love this ladder. Our coach has the rear ladder removed so we bought this. It's awesome. Well built and super functional with a lot of reach. When you lower it though, watch the fingers and skin between the thumb and forefinger but it will bite you. The release buttons are strong but when you need to lower the ladder, you use your thumbs and if you hold it wrong, the dropping final step can tag that skin. I will say though that it's still safe and a wonderful addition to our coach!
customer_reviews.author: Proost

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.text: When it works it works good. But....it only lasted a few months. The bottom pin does not work at all now. Seller says its out of return time and manufacturer says to ship it back to them at my cost. According to the manufacturer this has been a problem for a while.
customer_reviews.author: Matt G

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, until it isn't.
customer_reviews.text: This ladder was awesome when it was new. I used it for work for about five months. The first few months it was great, then the problems started. Buttons were really hard to push in and it didn't slide up and down smoothly anymore. I followed the maintenance instructions with some silicone polish and now it seems to stick even worse. Not sure if the contractors is any better quality. If you don't need to use a ladder very often then it's probably good for you, if you need it for work I'd pass for sure. It sat in the box for a year before I started using it or else I'd definitely try to return it. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Brett

customer_reviews.title: It works but the design quality isn't really there
customer_reviews.text: Retracting the ladder requires you to press the two buttons on the side with your thumbs. You need to do this per section. The buttons are super hard to press simultaneously making it a struggle to retract the ladder. The design is a bit weird in that by pressing the two thumb buttons you don't necessarily retract the section above you. It could be that it is two sections above that gets retracted when you press these button. And be careful your hands will be pinched on a slamming retracting section.
customer_reviews.author: Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: nice height, but heavy to carry.
customer_reviews.text: It works. nice height, but very heavy. I thought I would not have to carry around a heavy ladder again, but this does save space and can be easily carried in a car or truck. But as the instructions say, watch out for when it's closing down, you will get nipped at least once and learn the lesson on how to best close it. Just wish it was made of carbon fiber and half the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Not Cheap, But Would You Want a Cheap Stepladder?
customer_reviews.text: Was surprised to find that stepladders were so expensive, and this one is no exeception. But I guess this is not the sort of product on which a manufactuer, or a consumer, wants to cut corners. This ladder delivers as promised -- stores easily and although a bit heavy, can be tucked under one arm and carried without much trouble. DO BE CAREFUL when collapsing it; it is very easy to pinch your fingers badly, if you're not paying attention.
customer_reviews.author: Shupac

customer_reviews.title: Handing smasher/pincher
customer_reviews.text: Really heavy duty (and heavy), but these things are dangerous you have to be careful opening and closing. You'll get your hand caught and the chance for serious injury is high. 1st day I caught my finger in it and ripped off good chunk of skin. I don't know how this style of ladder gets approved but really shouldn't be selling them until they come up with a different way of closing them. Be forewarned it's dangerous. It's very heavy, but that gives it that Pro distinction so no complaint there. It is hard to move around but it is solid.
customer_reviews.author: Gadget

customer_reviews.title: Top ten purhcases of all time
customer_reviews.text: I'm an extremely hard to please customer. I hate almost every product I have ever bought because of some stupid issue or other that they should've avoided. This is one of maybe ten products that I've bought that I can whole heartedly recommend. It's light, compact, lots of range, easy to use, sturdy. Exactly what I wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Sylvan

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and easy to use indoors, all the way to ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: It is a bit heavy, but very steady and much easier to maneuver inside the house and get all the way to ceiling. Easy to extend, but difficult to retract, if you follow instructions (last few section have too much weight on them for latches to slide easily. My painter friend showed me the easy way: pull up a bit on an uncollapsed section to take weight off and throw first on (eg left) latch and then the other (eg right) of section you are collapsing.
customer_reviews.author: NotTheDude

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, until it fails
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this ladder from Amazon in 2013 for $260 plus tax. Worked great until last week when my contractor was a few feet in the air and one of the rungs collapsed on one side. This ladder only has a 6-month warranty -- I didn't use the ladder enough in that time period to discover the weak link, so the manufacturer was not helpful in response to my contacting them.
customer_reviews.author: Naomi H

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality built
customer_reviews.text: From day one I was having a hard time closing the ladder, one of the clips broke and now I can't put in the back of my car. It is unfortunate that now I am stuck with a broken ladder, very poor quality built. Good thing I have another ladder but was hoping it this one would make things easier for me. My colleagues have same ladder but theirs are much better.
customer_reviews.author: jose c. reyes

customer_reviews.title: Great Handy Ladder!
customer_reviews.text: From a place of storage and use, this is a perfect Ladder, just one thing make sure you keep your fingers away and safe when collapsing the unit.... it could hurt. so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Rene Lagler

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I find it difficult to extend, and I have never figured out how to extend only the bottom rungs. Sometimes I only need it to be a few feet up, but it only seems to extend from the top rungs. Even though I have been very careful when letting the rungs down, I have pinched my fingers. Once it is extended, it becomes to heavy and awkward for me to move. I should have gotten a regular aluminum ladder instead.
customer_reviews.author: practicalminded

customer_reviews.title: Amazing investment for the long run
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a cheaper version of this ladder from a different retailer and a rung fell out from under me on the first use. This ladder is incredible. It is well made, sturdy, comfortable and easy to use. I highly recommend this to any homeowner or apartment renter. I have a loft and this made putting up pictures and hanging curtains a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Doron

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT USE THIS LADDER ON SMOOTH SURFACES!!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT USE THIS LADDER ON SMOOTH SURFACES!!!! I am a home inspector, and I really liked this ladder when I first purchased it. However, it didn't take long for the releases to start sticking to the point it was difficult to collapse the ladder. Also, this things slides badly on smooth surfaces. 2 days ago I fell 10 feet, because this ladder slid out from under me just as I was getting ready to step into the roof. Luckily nothing was broken, but I won't be able to do inspections for at least a week until I heal up. Back to Little Giant ladders I go.
customer_reviews.author: mmohn01

customer_reviews.title: Does what it should and well, too!
customer_reviews.text: I use this for clearing gutters. It is nice to have a ladder that is solid, strong, and stable. It doesn't fold; rather, it telescopes into a very manageable size. Much better than cheap extending ladders that are lightweight yet wobbly. Highly recommended, as I'm over 70 yet the ladder when collapsed is pretty easy to handle and storage is a breeze. I was thinking about 5 stars, but I have that rating for over the top, truly outstanding things: This came really close.
customer_reviews.author: Roo Oortcloud

customer_reviews.title: probably the best compromise with its sturdiness
customer_reviews.text: This ladder really works as promised. It collapses into a small package, and is ideal to carry along on my trips with 5th-wheel RV. It is a bit on the heavy side, probably the best compromise with its sturdiness. The directions call for the ladder to be extended from the bottom up. This is quite difficult, given its weight. I prefer to extend it from the top, collapsing any excess at the top, if necessary, at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Ellermeier

customer_reviews.title: Ladder is great!
customer_reviews.text: Ladder holds me up just fine and is steady, for aluminum. Raising and lower requires awareness of where you put your fingers. The reason for 4 stars is the fact that the releases are plastic. Time will tell how long it will last before one breaks off. Fits perfect in my camper storage compartment. I also bought the silicone cushion for the top rung against my camper.
customer_reviews.author: S. Darnell

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: great design, great engineering. Performs as described. I admit I was a bit hesitant on the whole 're-inventing the cartwheel concept' but after watching a few first hand consumers results on youtube I was sold. I like the fact that I can throw (figuratively speaking, the thing weighs about 40lbs!) in my truck or back seat. Pros: compact brilliant design, price, extension. cons: doesn't always collapse in a smooth manner, also: wear gloves- extreme, (repeat extreme) pinching potential when collapsing.
customer_reviews.author: JAMES KERRY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Store / Slips at the top a bit
customer_reviews.text: This ladder was used by my husband to hang lights. The base is sturdy, however, the top tended to slip off of the wall a bit. It gets the job done, but you absolutely need a second person to make sure it doesn't slide off the wall during use.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder!
customer_reviews.text: Very nice ladder! Operated smoothly. Still a bit heavier than I expected, but still much easier to get around than a regular ladder!
customer_reviews.author: Ted Buhner

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder ever!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my hubby - using for our RV! Sturdy, doesn't take up much real estate in the packing/truck. Even I have used it and it's rock solid to stand on!
customer_reviews.author: Liz F

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m 5’7” and weight about 180lbs and I have been using this ladder for awhile now and aside from it being pretty heavy this ladder is absolutely perfect. I’ve never felt worried climbing up it and I’ve even had coworkers weighing up to 250-300lbs walking up it with absolutely no problem. This ladder is insanely sturdy and built flawlessly.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Alexander

customer_reviews.title: This ladder solves problems
customer_reviews.text: I'm a home inspector. Throwing this in the trunk of my car allows me to get more out of the standard mileage deduction. Any roof that can be reached safely, this ladder will get me there.
customer_reviews.author: Thompson

customer_reviews.title: One of the best ladders I've ever bought
customer_reviews.text: One of the best ladders I've ever bought! I purchased a second one for my nephew, who owns several rental properties, because its so easy to transport and allows him to reach virtually anywhere on the house, easily. It's not the lightest on the market, but the portability is amazing for a ladder of this length! Toss it in the trunk of a car, back seat of an SUV or truck. No rack necessary!
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer LaKey

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, compact and strong!
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this to estimate roofing. It fits in a trunk easily and still fully extends, closes easily (read and follow instructions as to not catch fingers in it), and is super strong so you won't worry about it closing unexpectedly. This ladder is an indispensable part of his job!
customer_reviews.author: L A Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic ladder
customer_reviews.text: I've been researching these ladders for over a year and sat on the fence for a long time until we had a contractor at our house doing some roof work and they had one of these. It was amazing how maneuverable this ladder is and how fast it goes up and comes back down. If you are looking for a very portable ladder, this is your answer.
customer_reviews.author: David H.

customer_reviews.title: So Easy!!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for our MH that does not enable my husband to get on top to blow off debris while traveling ..... It is easy to open, easy to close and I feel very at ease while he is using it alone .... the best part is it has safety a feature so if the ladder should collapse for some odd reason, It will NOT cut your fingers off!! Very light and movable....
customer_reviews.author: CHays

customer_reviews.title: Only buy this if you have large, strong hands!
customer_reviews.text: You need large, very strong hands to use this ladder. The mechanism for collapsing the steps requires a lot of hand strength. I cannot do it without another person helping. It’s heavy, which isn’t a big problem for moving when it is collapsed, but moving it while extended takes more than one person, as it easily topples over. I can’t use this ladder by myself, and I’m 5’7”, strong, and used to doing all the work around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: great for double pull ups for complex buildings
customer_reviews.text: I use this every day several times for work. it heavier that most telescoping ladders, but it's also much taller than most. i drive a dodge nitro and it bungies to the back of the back seat and it totally out of the way. great for double pull ups for complex buildings. sometimes i do have to slam a rung to get it to lock, that's the only down side to this ladder. also not good to exceed the weight limit. 250lbs I believe. easy to exceed it carrying tools or a bundle of shingles.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Foster

customer_reviews.title: These ladders are the best
customer_reviews.text: These ladders can be carried virtually anywhere you can carry them and adjust height for your needs. The flexibility may be startling at first but I have used and tested these ladders for a few years now and I have never had a concern, they are sturdy. Use safe practices when fully extended, as they are light weight and can slide away if not secured but I prefer these ladders over others for the maneuverability and durability over heavier standard ladders. A good buy.
customer_reviews.author: cogswell

customer_reviews.title: It’s Heavy
customer_reviews.text: Sent it back two day’s later, two heavy for me & I'm a Home Inspector, think I’ll order the smaller yellow one & continue with my large Werner For larger roofs.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Byfield

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder for my RV!
customer_reviews.text: Great ladder at a good price. Easy to open and close. Easily see how hand damage could happen, just need to be careful collapsing it. Only reason for 4 stars is the Velcro strap, will eventually loose its grip like all Velcro does
customer_reviews.author: CGB

customer_reviews.title: Watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.text: We needed the heigth that this ladder provided in a compact package, so plus. The ladder seems sturdy when extended; plus. Minus: the ladder is fairly heavy, but you really can't get away from that. But the biggest issues is; you had better be really aware and carefull when you put this ladder back down, because it comes really quickly and hard. I don't think I am exaggerating when I say your fingers would be seriously injured or severed if they were in the wrong place. I debated too long about whether we should keep it and am past the window for returning it, but probably should have.
customer_reviews.author: Ruthie

customer_reviews.title: The ladder was broken into half
customer_reviews.text: I have had this ladder for less than 9 months with very limited usage. It was broken in half while i tried to get to the roof top. I was almost drop. I am not reaching half of the weight capacity and i carried nothing with me while climbing. It is a safety hazard!
customer_reviews.author: JZ

customer_reviews.title: This is a great portable extension ladder for those times when you need ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great portable extension ladder for those times when you need to transport a lot of ladder in a small space. They seem to have thought of everything included a soft rubber pad to carry it by on the tie down strap.
customer_reviews.author: Penguin Life

customer_reviews.title: Best ladder I could use
customer_reviews.text: Best ladder I could use, other than extension ladder. It's a little heavy, but it's not unwieldy other collapsible ladders. Watch the skin between your thumb and forefinger when collapsing; it hurts like crazy!! I use this ladder almost daily and have not had any issues with it. Even when used in the rain its good. I love the rubber feet, which work well in people's homes and don't scuff the floors.
customer_reviews.author: GPD

customer_reviews.title: 16' super sturdy and grippy feet
customer_reviews.text: this ladder is so awsome!.i do sales for a roofing company so I am up and down houses and commercial properties all the time.16' super sturdy and grippy feet.easy to get in and out of a truck or especially a car.i 100% suggest you buy this ladder...even if you don't need a ladder you should by this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy to carry
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would weigh less. As a female, it is too heavy for me to carry. Kinda defeats the purpose for me--I had wanted something I could easily manipulate--this isn't it!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Schumann

customer_reviews.title: Ladder Love
customer_reviews.text: My husband is obsessed with this later. You'd think he'd brought a brand new car, or got a younger, better looking girlfriend. He's always looking for an opportunity to take it out, caress it, to show me how handy it is, how sturdy, how useful, how sexily and easily it folds down. It collapses to almost nothing and stores easily. I'm so ****ing tired of hearing about his ladder. Oh well, it could be liquor and women. An A++++, on his behalf.
customer_reviews.author: Springlering

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy feel for my 190 lbs
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT ladder ! Sturdy feel for my 190 lbs. Great length & not too big when collapsed. Operation has been easy to perform, buttons have good feel. Hope they stay that way ! Sugget getting the rubber guard for the top rail. It should be standard but its not. The bag is nice, but pricy but my use is in CA desert - i hoped to protect the ladder from the blowing dust & sand. So far so good !
customer_reviews.author: Idaho

customer_reviews.title: Pain to break down
customer_reviews.text: I was planning on using this for satellite installations but breaking it down 3 or 5 x daily would be a chore. A single use for private residential stuff is OK. But I prefer the little Giant Ladder and get 2x the height for the same weight.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin's Tiger

customer_reviews.title: My most used ladder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great ladder. So easy to use and feels very sturdy. Easy to carry around and reaches every single roof line on my house with no problem. After getting this ladder I only use my heavy extension ladders if there is no ledge to rest this ladder on.
customer_reviews.author: MBreiy

customer_reviews.title: Big Boy
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is long and heavy. Compact for a 18' ladder which I would have had no room to store. The extra length is worth the price considering you can stand safely on the top 3 rungs (most of us). it feels solid and packs away nicely in the closet. The weight makes it a little top heavy compared to an aluminum extension ladder so watch the slope when setting it against a wall. I would recommend this to anyone lacking to room to store or needing something portable. Fits nicely in the back of my Corvette along with my tool kit. You'll get a lot of where did you get that comments.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and way cheaper than Menards
customer_reviews.text: I'm on roof's all the time and drive a lot. Not only does this allow me to drive a smaller, gas friendly vehicle with the room it saves, but it's great getting on the roofs.
customer_reviews.author: scott from Minnesota

customer_reviews.title: Would Never Buy Again
customer_reviews.text: We owned a roofing business and bought two of these ladders. We didn't use them right away, but when we did we noticed the quality of the ladders were poor and they were assembled incorrectly by the manufacturer. We could not risk any of our employees getting hurt by using these ladders, so we wasted our money because it was too late to return them even though we reached out to the manufacturer to let them know the issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joy Matt

customer_reviews.title: Long delivery time, not what expected
customer_reviews.text: Deivery was almost 2 weeks later than expected. Finger crusher - bad design. Putzy retraction - requires every rung be individually dropped. Flimsier that others I have used. Weight was greater than expected for as flimsy as this was.
customer_reviews.author: Dana C.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and to store.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use! I am not very strong, and this is a little heavy but when it is collapsed so much easier to move around than a regular extension ladder. It feels more sturdy and steady than a regular extension ladder (and I have used contractors' ladders before). I didn't realize how simple it would be to adjust the height. Plus it is a LOT easier to store and takes up less space. I hung my regular extension ladder on the wall and it was always a hassle to take down (usually took 2 people).
customer_reviews.author: AEB

customer_reviews.title: Easily fits in my trunk or back seat
customer_reviews.text: Saw my home inspector use it and I had to have one. I wish it were taller, but that's not the fault of the product. it takes up so much less room than any standard 15 foot ladder. Easily fits in my trunk or back seat. Action is smooth. Just watch your hands and fingers.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Light weight, and sturdy too!
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought this for his job as a home inspector. He gets on several roofs a day, and needed something to fit in the back of the car. This is sturdy enough for him (230lbs) to use repeatedly, and lightweight enough for little ol me to move around if I need to. We have not had any longer pinching problems as other reviews have suggested. The ladder keeps a gap between two rungs so this doesn't happen. We highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Ronda

customer_reviews.title: It is beefier than expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just got and tried it out and it works great. Exactly as pictured and described. It is beefier than expected. **It will pinch your fingers if you don't pay attention. I will post any future issues.
customer_reviews.author: The Carpenter

customer_reviews.title: Stepin it up!
customer_reviews.text: I got this ladder because I work for my family's roofing company and didn't have a truck to haul a ladder. THIS IS PERFECT! I feel safe when I use it and it's easy to travel with in the trunk of my car. The green indicators let you know the steps are in place. So far I've yet to have any issue while using it. Would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: christina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best ladder and great for Storm Chasers. The biggest issue I've had are the locking mechanisms which when fully extended, it's tough to get the ladder back down without having to use something to hit the tabs inward to bring it down. Other than that, it's a great ladder and great for double pulls.
customer_reviews.author: Tex Scott Ritter

customer_reviews.title: One of the blue latches on the low rung fell ...
customer_reviews.text: One of the blue latches on the low rung fell off the second time I used the ladder. Seems very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel C. Beaudoin

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty-Will Last!
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased my second one after my first has lasted two years of daily use. Very sturdy unlike the cheaper versions out there. The little tabs get loose and stick a bit but overall an excellent ladder. I have put this ladder through tremendous amounts of use and I still feel completely safe on it. I passed the old one down to another employee once I got the new one.
customer_reviews.author: Jared L

customer_reviews.title: Excellent choice for reaching roofs of ranch and lower style ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent choice for reaching roofs of ranch and lower style roofs. Very easy to extend. A bit heavy but no heavier than an extension ladder of similar size. Does not "walk" while extended on a sidewalk. Thumb tabs are easy to use - keep your other fingers out of the way! Very compact as I keep it in the back seat of my truck for roofing estimates. Ready to use right out of the box. I will by another if needed as it is much more convenient than a 16 ft extension ladder.
customer_reviews.author: PW

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: Great in terms of height, just okay in terms of opening/closing. It's definitely easy to pinch if not being very careful when closing. Latches are a bit stiff, but they are holding up quite a bit of weight so that's not surprising. It's a pretty heavy ladder, so if you do not need this height, you might consider getting the shorter/lighter version. I can carry it without problems, but would not want to carry it more than a few dozen feet.
customer_reviews.author: David G

customer_reviews.title: I love how this will fit easily in my chevy cruze
customer_reviews.text: I sell solar. I love how this will fit easily in my chevy cruze. When I check on roofs I have many homeowners compliment me on my ladder and ask where I got it. It's funny to them how high this ladder extends when I pull it out of my little bitty trunk. I love the portability.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Compact and portable
customer_reviews.text: I use this ladder 2-3 times per week and it is fantastic. You might think that the ~35lbs is a bit heavy but having such a compact and portable ladder is great when you do not have much space in your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: This ladder is awesome! It's so compact
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is awesome! It's so compact, easy to move when collapsed, easy to extend and collapse. The design of the release levers make it seem almost impossible to pinch your fingers, but we're still careful because each rung is heavy enough to where it would really hurt if you got your finger pinched/stuck in there. It feels sturdy when climbing it, even when it's fully extended. I would buy it again mainly because it's so compact when storing.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Great telescoping ladder!
customer_reviews.text: I use the Xtend & Climb 785P to get into my attic on the second floor. It's great that I can store it in my closet without it taking up much room. The 40lb weight isn't too bad considering typical A-frame ladders can weight much more. Extending and retracting the ladder is easy. Sometimes the buttons will stick as I try to retract the ladder, but all you need to do is extend that section till it clicks again to be able to retract. Overall: Great ladder, small footprint, a little hefty, but strong and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: TT

customer_reviews.title: Great, compact ladder
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful product! Compact, sturdy, lightweight (compared to other ladders) but versatile and functional. Watch your fingers when collapsing!
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Great Ladder.....
customer_reviews.text: This is an expensive ladder but it is very well made. Small and compact, yet it extends to about 15 feet. One recommendation that I'd make is to wipe off the telescoping tubes before retracting it with a clean cloth and use a bit of silicone spray to ensure smooth retraction. I know that this is an expensive ladder, but as stated earlier it is very well made and the possibility of having it fail is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Keith A. previously in Silicon Valley (now WA.)

customer_reviews.title: We are very pleased with the quality and portability of this ladder
customer_reviews.text: We are very pleased with the quality and portability of this ladder. My husband has experienced several falls from wobbly ladders so I was more than happy to pay a higher price for something more sturdy. The home inspector that inspected a home we recently sold had a ladder like this and recommended it. I'm glad he did. He said it was OSHA approved. I didn't look into that claim but took his word for it.
customer_reviews.author: SMK

customer_reviews.title: NO CUSTOMER SUPPORT for defective ladder
customer_reviews.text: Last time I used the Xtend & Climb ladder one of the latches separated from the bottom ladder section, so now I cannot fully collapse the ladder. Two weeks ago I emailed customer support inquiring as to how I could repair the broken latch but I have not received a reply.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis W

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a heavy duty space saving ladder
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a heavy duty space saving ladder, easy to carry and load in truck/trunk. I will agree with some other users here, the pinching and extension of the ladder takes some time to get use to. Be careful where you are collapsing your ladder...i recommend pinch releasing outside on soft ground like grass. The initial telescoping is a bit tricky.
customer_reviews.author: Ak303

customer_reviews.title: Great Product - Fall in love with a Ladder.
customer_reviews.text: I love my Extend and Climb Ladder. Little heavy than I was expecting, but still manageable when moving it around. Easy to put up and down. Can easily be handled by one person. My main reason for liking this ladder so much is it's ability to fold down and not take up a lot of space. Very sturdy and Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Timc0203

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for commercial use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 15.5 height which adds a bit of weight. This brand has s worth buying if you are in business to use a ladder several times a day but it’s very heavy so be warned.
customer_reviews.author: DT

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, small package!
customer_reviews.text: All of these ladders have tabs for each step and those tabs are sometimes hard to press in to collapse even when they're brand new. This is the heavy duty version, longer and holds more weight, the 12.5 ft version is better for the average person. Still, at 215 pounds, I'm glad I got this one. There's no better ladder that folds up this small! This one is significantly heavier than the 12.5 ft version, so again - get that one if you're a casual user or weighing 200 pounds or less. The lost star is only because the tabs are hard to press in to collapse, this is a fantastic ladder.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Douglas

customer_reviews.title: While I love the ladder and the price and value were great
customer_reviews.text: While I love the ladder and the price and value were great, I cannot give it 5 stars because I've had it less than a month and I already get some of the slides sticking. I guess I need to use some silicone spray on them. But this shouldn't be happening so soon after purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Light, Sturdy, Quality.
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with the quality of this ladder. It is fairly light weight and sturdy. Using this for my home inspection business, it fits nicely in the back of my 4Runner. The only warning is... WATCH YOUR FINGERS WHEN CLOSING. The optional top rung protector keeps from leaving marks and fits snug.
customer_reviews.author: KurtMatthew

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $
customer_reviews.text: Not cheap but tough as hell. I own a roofing co. So I use these daily (I own 2 ladders) however even if you use it infrequently Id think it would be worth it as it takes up so little space. I don't know if I would suggest it for elderly people as its not light and the buttons can be a bit tough to press to lower the rungs down.
customer_reviews.author: aaron cussen

customer_reviews.title: Every time we use it to work on high walls ...
customer_reviews.text: Every time we use it to work on high walls (e.g. stairwells if you build a small scaffolding, or on vaulted ceilings), I marvel at this design. Not the lightest, but given that I can carry it under one arm, and it can do things a reasonably sized A-frame simply can't do, it's a solid win. Will always have one on hand!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder, appreciate the collapsing feature
customer_reviews.text: Have several larger ladders. Needed one that I can put in the car with some degree of reach. Opted for the professional series one. Easy to retract and pack away.
customer_reviews.author: Neil, VA

customer_reviews.title: GET item to have in the garage
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my brother, in construction, easy to set up, important--read instructions, also researched and this one was the best I think, anyway, great item to have for work or home.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Jean Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy well made ladder.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and portable. Smooth and easy to use. I recommend this ladder.
customer_reviews.author: MJF

customer_reviews.title: Ladder Received With a Defect
customer_reviews.text: One of the buttons to retract the ladder has been very difficult to operate since the ladder was received 2-months ago. I was hoping the button would loosen up and function better with some use, but it has not. Contacting the manufacturer for warranty. The ladder has a 6-month warranty.
customer_reviews.author: EngineerinMe

customer_reviews.title: A Lot of Ladder in a Tiny Package
customer_reviews.text: This ladder is very tall when fully extended but pretty hard to move around. When collapsed it is very easy to carry and store. I'm happy with the purchase but I think if you plan to use the ladder frequently, I would go with a traditional extension ladder which is much easier to handle and get in the right position. Overall it is a very impressive and amazing product.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Just be careful when collapsing, it can guillotine your finger(s). Well worthwhile, I got rid of my other ladders. It even works on attic access points located in the middle of a garage/room. Just extend it up, gently push the cover up.
customer_reviews.author: john paul deoliveira

customer_reviews.title: This ain't your daddy's extension ladder
customer_reviews.text: I resisted buying an extension ladder for many years since I didn't want to store a big, bulky thing in my garage. This ladder provides the same capabilities as the old style ladders and I can store it anywhere -- take it anywhere. It's sturdy when extended and relatively easy to contract. I did pinch a finger lowering it once so you have to watch that. But, you can hurt yourself with any ladder. So, 5 solid stars.
customer_reviews.author: S. C. Broshar

customer_reviews.title: Great ladder
customer_reviews.text: I have numerous ladders because of my job, but this is by far my go to ladder! I can carry it with one hand and it extends pretty far for me to reach high places. It is so easy to transport too. Takes up no room unlike my other heavy ladders. A must buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: A. Bunker

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed is not a strong enough statement!
customer_reviews.text: At first this product worked fine, but as time went on it became very hard to extend and retract. Also, do NOT use this product for any painting, any overspray that gets on the ladder makes it impossible to use. To say the least, I am very disappointed and wish I would have bought a different one.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas L Wickham

customer_reviews.title: easy to use
customer_reviews.text: easy to use. i agree with the other users, the tabs to go up and down need to be aware when putting it up and down. it is absolutely what we need in our 15 ft closets. ordering 2 more for other closet.
customer_reviews.author: Moonlight Glitter Girl

customer_reviews.title: Not safe
customer_reviews.text: Returning. Couldn’t get it to latch properly. Hard to lower once extended. Never say “green” on bottom 3 rungs. Seems unsafe.
customer_reviews.author: Old Dan

customer_reviews.title: wearing fast
customer_reviews.text: the mechanical useage has been good, sometimes it does stick open and you have to spend a few minutes messing with it to get it to come down. My main issue is that the soft pad on the underneath where you are supposed to carry it by is already torn! This is not a good sign as I've only been using it for about 4 months. This piece clearly needs to be addressed in the durability department.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Buttons beak easy/short warranty
customer_reviews.text: I use this ladder about 2 maybe 3 times a year. The retractable buttons broke/ won’t go back. The warranty is only good for 6 months. That should tell you everything you need to know.
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni Angon

customer_reviews.title: Yes!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worth the cost! Totally exceeded my expectations! Quality is amazing. Incredible for daily work or home use. I am 250lbs and it is the most solid ladder I have ever used. Buying one for my son for Xmas. Don't think twice. Buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain TJ

customer_reviews.title: really works, Well Made
customer_reviews.text: Was not sure if this would be a gimmick but very useable and strong
customer_reviews.author: greg kiger

product_meta.title: Xtend & Climb 785P Aluminum Telescoping Ladder Type I Professional Series, 15.5-Foot
product_meta.description:
Style:Classic Pro Series 785P, Blue 12.5ftXtend+Climb Telescoping Ladder, Heavy Duty, Series: Professional, 19.5 ft Reach Height, 250 lb. Load Capacity, 15.5 ft Height to Platform, 36 in Overall Height, 19-3/4 in Overall Width, 4-1/2 in Overall Depth, Aluminum Alloy, Clean Touch Anodized, ANSI Type I, OSHA Approved. Store ladder in a dry place to avoid moisture

AMAZON.COM
Designed for both commercial contractors and home do-it-yourselfers, Xtend & Climb Professional Edition Telescoping Ladders are a sensible alternative to traditional bulky extension ladders. Lightweight and durable, these heavy-duty, time-saving ladders extend by the foot and feature ergonomic designs and locking tabs for smooth, safe operation. The styling and strength of the Professional Edition ladders will make them the most favored tool on the jobsite.



Professional Edition Telescoping Ladders
At a Glance: * Heavy-duty telescoping ladder extends and locks by the foot
 * Red/green locking tab indicators for safe operation
 * No-Pinch Closure System; angled thumb release insures proper hand position
 * Closure strap and integrated handle for portability
 * Six-month warranty on parts and repair


Extends and locks by the foot, easily adjusting to whatever height you need. View larger.Extends and Locks by the Foot
Xtend & Climb Professional Edition Telescoping Ladders extend and lock by the foot, easily adjusting to whatever height is needed for your job. This comes in handy when you don't want the hassle of lugging around a heavy extension ladder. Just carry your Xtend & Climb Professional Edition where you need it and simply open it up, rung by rung.Safe and Easy to Operate
Designed with safety in mind, each of these telescoping ladders features a No-Pinch Closure System, as well as red/green tab indicators that let you know when the rungs are locked into place and the ladder is safe to climb. An angled thumb release ensures proper hand positioning and the ergonomic design allows for smooth operation. In addition, each Professional Edition ladder has non-slip end caps that help keep it firmly in place.Carry and Store Anywhere
Thanks to an integrated carrying handle and heavy-duty closure strap, the Xtend & Climb Professional Edition Telescoping Ladder can be taken anywhere, and it stores compactly in your garage or truck. For further convenience, a durable carry case is sold separately.

Constructed with Durable Materials
Made of Aerospace Engineered 6061 alloy with a Clean-Touch anodized finish, each heavy-duty Xtend & Climb Professional Edition ladder has rungs that are built tough to ensure sturdy footing. With larger duty ratings than the original Xtend & Climb ladders, the Professional Edition ladders can withstand even the most demanding jobs.

Each Xtend & Climb Professional Edition Telescoping Ladder is backed by a six-month warranty on parts and repair.

What's in the Box
Xtend & Climb Professional Edition Telescoping Ladder.





Professional Edition Telescoping LaddersModel780p785pHeight Open12-1/2 feet15-1/2 feetHeight Closed32-1/4 inches36-1/2 inchesWeight19-3/4 inches19-3/4 inchesDepth3-3/4 inches3-3/4 inchesWeight32 pounds36 poundsANSI Duty RatingType IA (300 pounds)Type I (250 pounds)


FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Professional Series - Industrial Grade Telescoping ladder with plastic couplings easily extends locks, by the foot, to 15.5-feet from a compact 37.8-inches. It's unique, portable and compact design allows you to carry it anywhere and easily store in a trunk or closet. It is engineered manufactured to meet or exceed rigid industrial standards, constructed using 6061 Alloy and is lightweight at 35 lbs. This Model # 785P is ANSI Type I (250 lbs). A durable carrying bag (part # 782) is available for an additional charge.

See more
feature_bullets: Extends and locks by the foot with easy no pinch closure system
Integrated carrying handle heavy duty closure strap and extended ladder height is 15 feet 6 inches
No pinch closure system non-slip end caps. Weight: 36 pounds

specifications.Warranty Description: Limited Warranty - Free from manufacturer defects in materials or workmanship for a period of six
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars855 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
